"""
Improved scaling‐law model for LLM training loss using a log‐linear (power‐law) form
Predicted loss L = exp(a0) * lr^{a1} * bsz^{a2} * data_size^{a3} * param_size^{a4}
Fitting is done via a linear least‐squares in log‐space for stability and speed.
"""
import numpy as np

def scaling_law_func(data_points, params):
    """
    data_points: (N,4) array with columns [lr, bsz, data_size, non_embedding_param_size]
    params: 1D array of length 5 (or 2D array of shape (T,5) for T parallel models)
            params[0] = intercept a0
            params[1:] = slopes [a1, a2, a3, a4]
    Returns: 
      If params is 1D, returns (N,) array of predicted losses.
      If params is 2D (T,5), returns (N,T) array of predicted losses for each param set.
    """
    X = np.atleast_2d(np.asarray(data_points, dtype=float))
    if X.shape[1] != 4:
        raise ValueError(f"Expected data_points with 4 features, got shape {X.shape}")
    # Transform features to log‐space
    logX = np.log(X)
    p = np.asarray(params, dtype=float)
    
    # Single parameter set
    if p.ndim == 1:
        if p.shape[0] != 5:
            raise ValueError(f"Expected params of length 5, got length {p.shape[0]}")
        a0 = p[0]
        slopes = p[1:]            # length 4
        log_pred = a0 + logX.dot(slopes)
        return np.exp(log_pred)
    
    # Multiple parameter sets in parallel (shape (T,5))
    elif p.ndim == 2:
        T, P = p.shape
        if P != 5:
            raise ValueError(f"Expected params.shape[1]==5, got {P}")
        a0 = p[:, 0]              # shape (T,)
        slopes = p[:, 1:]         # shape (T,4)
        # logX @ slopes.T -> (N,T)
        log_pred = logX.dot(slopes.T) + a0[None, :]
        return np.exp(log_pred)
    
    else:
        raise ValueError(f"params must be 1D or 2D array, got ndim={p.ndim}")


def fit_scaling_law(data_points, loss_values):
    """
    Fits the 5-parameter log‐linear model by solving a linear least‐squares
    problem in log‐space:
      minimize || [1, log(lr), log(bsz), log(data_size), log(param_size)] @ params - log(loss) ||^2
    Returns:
      params: 1D array of length 5 = [a0, a1, a2, a3, a4]
    """
    X = np.atleast_2d(np.asarray(data_points, dtype=float))
    if X.shape[1] != 4:
        raise ValueError(f"Expected data_points with 4 features, got shape {X.shape}")
    y = np.asarray(loss_values, dtype=float).ravel()
    if y.shape[0] != X.shape[0]:
        raise ValueError("Number of loss values must match number of data points")
    
    # Small epsilon to avoid log(0)
    eps = 1e-12
    logX = np.log(X)
    logy = np.log(y + eps)
    
    # Build design matrix A = [1 | log(lr) log(bsz) log(data_size) log(param_size)]
    N = X.shape[0]
    A = np.concatenate([np.ones((N, 1)), logX], axis=1)  # shape (N,5)
    
    # Solve least squares: minimize ||A @ p - logy||^2
    params, *_ = np.linalg.lstsq(A, logy, rcond=None)
    # params is shape (5,)
    return params
